message:
Windows is inching closer to full apt-get experience without Microsoft help
http://boxstarter.org/
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: there is also an excellent apt-get like tool for windows called "chocolatey" https://chocolatey.org/
new projects are coming out soooo fast that i hear about nearly 5 new projects each day
Mohamed El Sayed: It says on the website that Boxstarter actually makes use of Chocolatey to do its thing :)
The proper scripted install + configuration experience in Windows v. Next (and todays' s PowerShell will be created by Microsoft. It's called OneGet https://github.com/OneGet/oneget
Combining PowerShell DSC (Desired State Configuration) and Chocolatey, plus more goodness. ..

Related, from Twitter now:

Check out @nicemarmot's Tweet: https://twitter.com/nicemarmot/status/461642016548347904

Other than the Boxstarter commands that are imported into all Boxstarter Installation sessions, you will likely recognize this syntax if you are already familiar with Chocolatey. This script is going to configure Windows Explorer in a way that won't drive you crazy, allow you to use Remote Desktop to connect to the machine, install a handful of applications that you commonly use and install Hyper-V's virtualization host and the IIS Web Server.

Boxstarter can run any Chocolatey package. The only difference as far as the script is concerned is that your script also has access to Boxstarter's API for configuring Windows, running updates as well as logging and reboot control.
This OneGet stuff will huge if it comes quickly enough. Much needed for Windows.
yeah, I like how they didn't re-invent the wheel and made it so that things like Chocolatey can hook into OneGet!
